tool.name: ApplyMapFunctionbyID
tool.displayname: Apply Map Functions to Collection Dataset by Asset ID

param.name: data_type
param.displayname: Choose the type of the dataset to be filtered
param.dialogReference: Select the type of the Earth Engine dataset between feature collection and image collection

param.name: asset_id
param.displayname: Specify the asset id of the dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the asset ID of the dataset.

param.name: map_file
param.displayname: Select the Python script that contains map functions
param.dialogReference: Select the python script that stores the map functions. The python script is used as a module or library. The available map functions will be extracted and listed below.

param.name: map_functions
param.displayname: Select the map functions to apply
param.dialogReference: Select the map functions to apply to the dataset. You can select as many as needed.

param.name: out_json
param.displayname: Specify the output JSON file to save the string format of the filtered dataset
param.dialogReference: Save the processed dataset as a serialized JSON object for future use. When you use this JSON file again, the dataset will already have the map functions applied.

tool.summary:
This script applies user-define map functions to the feature collection or image collection dataset by asset ID and saves the processed dataset to a serialized JSON object for future use.

For a quick guide on mapping over image collection dataset, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/ic_mapping

For a quick guide on mapping over feature collection dataset, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/feature_collection_mapping

idCitation.resTitle: Apply Map Functions to Collection Dataset by Asset ID
